com.defano.jmonet.tools.base

Class AbstractSelectionTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.PaintTool
      • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.AbstractSelectionTool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanvasCommitObserver, SurfaceInteractionObserver, MutableSelection, TransformableSelection, MarchingAntsObserver, KeyListener, EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractTransformTool, LassoTool, RotateTool, SelectionTool

    public abstract class AbstractSelectionTool
extends PaintTool
implements MarchingAntsObserver, TransformableSelection
    Mouse and keyboard handler for drawing selections (free-form or bounded) on the canvas.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

    • Method Detail

      • addSelectionPoint

        protected abstract void addSelectionPoint(Point initialPoint,
                                          Point newPoint,
                                          boolean isShiftKeyDown)
        Invoked to indicate that the user has defined a new point on the selection path.
        Parameters:
        initialPoint - The first point defined by the user (i.e., where the mouse was initially pressed)
        newPoint - A new point to append to the selection path (i.e., where the mouse is now)
        isShiftKeyDown - When true, indicates user is holding the shift key down

      • completeSelection

        protected abstract void completeSelection(Point finalPoint)
        Invoked to indicate that the given point should be considered the last point in the selection path.
        Parameters:
        finalPoint - The final point on the selection path.

      • createSelection

        public void createSelection(Rectangle bounds)
        Creates a selection bounded by the given rectangle. Equivalent to the user clicking and dragging from the top- left to the bottom-right of bounds.
        Parameters:
        bounds - The selection rectangle to create.

      • createSelection

        public void createSelection(BufferedImage image,
                            Point location)
        Creates a selection containing the given image at the requested location on the canvas.
        Parameters:
        image - The image contained by the selection. Note that the selection bounds will equal the bounds of this image.
        location - The location on the canvas where the selection (and image) will initially appear.

      • mouseMoved

        public void mouseMoved(MouseEvent e,
                       Point imageLocation)
        Invoked when the mouse cursor has been moved onto a component but no buttons have been pushed.

        Parameters:

        imageLocation - the location (relative to the image) where the event occurred

                         Point imageLocation)

        imageLocation - the location (relative to the image) where the event occurred

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e,
                         Point imageLocation)
        Invoked when a mouse button is pressed on a component and then dragged. MOUSE_DRAGGED events will continue to be delivered to the component where the drag originated until the mouse button is released (regardless of whether the mouse position is within the bounds of the component).

        Due to platform-dependent Drag&Drop implementations, MOUSE_DRAGGED events may not be delivered during a native Drag&Drop operation.

        Specified by:
        mouseDragged in interface SurfaceInteractionObserver
        Overrides:
        mouseDragged in class PaintTool
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        imageLocation - the location (relative to the image) where the event occurred

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent e,
                          Point imageLocation)
        Invoked when a mouse button has been released on a component.
        Specified by:
        mouseReleased in interface SurfaceInteractionObserver
        Overrides:
        mouseReleased in class PaintTool
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        imageLocation - the location (relative to the image) where the event occurred

      • activate

        public void activate(PaintCanvas canvas)
        Activates the tool on a given canvas. A paint tool does not "paint" on the canvas until it is activated. Typically, only one tool is active on a canvas at any given time, but there is no technical limitation preventing multiple tools from being active at once. Use PaintTool.deactivate() to stop this tool from painting on the canvas.
        Overrides:
        activate in class PaintTool
        Parameters:
        canvas - The paint canvas on which to activate the tool.

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Deactivates the tool on the canvas. A deactivated tool no longer affects the canvas and all listeners / observers are un-subscribed making the tool available for garbage collection.
        Overrides:
        deactivate in class PaintTool

      • morphSelection

        public void morphSelection(AbstractSelectionTool to)
        Takes the current selection represented by this tool and transfers it over to the given tool. Note that invoking this method clears the selection from this tool, but does not deactivate the tool from the canvas. In most uses, the caller will want to deactivate this tool immediately after calling this method. For example, this allows the user to draw a selection with the lasso tool and then transform it with a transform tool (i.e., PerspectiveTool without having to redraw the selection bounds.
        Parameters:
        to - The tool that the current selection should be transferred to.

      • pickupSelection

        public void pickupSelection()
        Add the graphics underneath the selection to the currently selected image. Has no effect if a selection is not active or has not been dirtied. This method "picks up" the paint underneath the selection (that wasn't part of the paint initially picked up when the selection bounds were defined).

      • getSelectedImageObservable

        public io.reactivex.Observable<Optional<BufferedImage>> getSelectedImageObservable()
        Gets an ImmuatableProvider containing the selected image, useful for observing changes made to the selected image.
        Returns:
        The provider.

      • getSelectedImage

        public BufferedImage getSelectedImage()
        Gets the image represented by the selection. Note that a user can select and modify a non-rectangular selection, but the selected image returned by this method will always be a rectangle whose bounds are the smallest rectangle that can fit in the selected shape. Any pixels outside the user's selection shape will be fully transparent pixels in the returned image.
        Specified by:
        getSelectedImage in interface MutableSelection
        Returns:
        The selected image

      • setSelectedImage

        public void setSelectedImage(BufferedImage selectedImage)
        Replaces the current selected image with the given image. It is the caller's responsibility to mask the given image to assure it does not exceed the selection bounds.
        Specified by:
        setSelectedImage in interface MutableSelection
        Parameters:
        selectedImage - The image with which to replace the selection.

      • clearSelection

        public void clearSelection()
        Clears the current selection frame (removes any "marching ants" from the canvas), but does not "erase" the selected image, nor does it commit the selected image.

      • deleteSelection

        public void deleteSelection()
        Deletes the selection image from the canvas and clears the selection (removes marching ants)

      • hasSelection

        public boolean hasSelection()
        Determines if the user has an active selection. A selection exists only after the user has completed defining a closed, selection outline.
        Specified by:
        hasSelection in interface MutableSelection
        Returns:
        True is a selection exists, false otherwise.

      • hasSelectionBounds

        public boolean hasSelectionBounds()
        Determines if the user has an active selection boundary (i.e., a rectangle of marching ants)

        Differs from hasSelection() in that when a user is dragging the selection rectangle, a selection boundary will exist but a selection will not. The selection is not made until the user releases the mouse.

        Returns:
        True if a selection boundary exists, false otherwise.

      • getSelectionFromCanvas

        protected void getSelectionFromCanvas()
        Make the canvas image bounded by the given selection shape the current selected image.

      • getSelectionLocation

        public Point getSelectionLocation()
        Determines the location (top-left coordinate) of the selection outline (MutableSelection.getSelectionOutline() on the canvas.
        Specified by:
        getSelectionLocation in interface MutableSelection
        Returns:
        Get the top-left coordinate of the selection boundary

      • finishSelection

        protected void finishSelection()
        Drops the selected image onto the canvas (committing the change) and clears the selection outline. This has the effect of completing a select-and-move operation.

      • redrawSelection

        public void redrawSelection()
        Clears the scratch buffer then draws the selected image and selection outline ("marching ants") onto it.
        Specified by:
        redrawSelection in interface MutableSelection

      • getSelectedImageLocation

        protected Point getSelectedImageLocation()
        Returns the location (top-left x,y coordinates) on the canvas where the selected image should be drawn. Typically, this is the location of the selection shape.

        However, for tools that mutate the selection shape (i.e., RotateTool), this location may need to be adjusted to account for changes to the selection shape's bounds.

        Returns:
        The x,y coordinate where the selected image should be drawn on the canvas.

      • drawSelectionOutline

        protected void drawSelectionOutline()
        Renders the selection outline (marching ants) on the canvas.

      • setDirty

        public void setDirty()
        Marks the selection as having been mutated (either by transformation or movement).
        Specified by:
        setDirty in interface MutableSelection

      • isDirty

        protected boolean isDirty()
        Determines if the current selection has been changed or moved in any way since the selection outline was defined.
        Returns:
        True if the selection was changed, false otherwise.

      • onCommit

        public void onCommit(PaintCanvas canvas,
                     ChangeSet changeSet,
                     BufferedImage canvasImage)
        Fires when an new shape or image is committed from scratch onto the canvas.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:
        onCommit in class PaintTool
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas on which the commit is occurring.
        changeSet - The set of changes being committed.
        canvasImage - The resulting canvas image (including the committed change)
